TopicTitle: something more than memories and spreadsheets - a museum

Articles.Content:
Wherever people go, they tend to collect something and bring it home - and especially when it is as far away as the moon or another planet.

Now, this will probably be a feast and a burdon for the graphics designers!

What if the science building at KSC also had a museum?

Whenever a Kerbal returns (!) from a mission or an experiment is brought back (!) a stone, lump of goo, odd thing, bit of a rocket ... is placed in the showroom of the specific celestial body, being somewhat unique in a way matching the pop-up report of the experiment.

Orbital/panoramic pictures documenting the event of every orbital/surface EVA report.

In the middle of every showroom hanging a scaled model of the respective moon or planet, being just a grey ball until the first orbit is established around its real counterpart.

Modelled as an IVA to walk around!

OK, scaling down the madness ...

A big closet with drawers for every celestial object to place the souvenirs and a photo album, kinda like the medals of X-Wing.

Maybe a zoomable 2D map of the system on a tablet, with maps of every visited body and markings of the visited biomes/conducted experiments.

Really just something else than a simple chart!

Please?

Edited October 22, 2013 by KerbMav
Read the list twice and all I could find was the IVA part which I only added in my mad bubbling dream.
Well, it's definitely been suggested several times, and with a post count like yours, you would think you'd have seen them.
Hey, the thing about that 2D map marked with the already explored biomes is awesome! It would help a lot when you are planning your next kerbal killing sess- *ahem * mission.
